solution_line_template: Since a dozen has {dozen_items} items, a half dozen has {half_fraction}*{dozen_items}=<<{half_fraction}*{dozen_items}={half_dozen_items}>>{half_dozen_items} items.

Since Jamal bought {num_half_dozens} half dozen colored crayons, he bought {num_half_dozens}*{half_dozen_items} = <<{num_half_dozens}*{half_dozen_items}={total_crayons}>>{total_crayons} colored crayons.
If each crayon's cost was ${cost_per_crayon}, Jamal paid ${cost_per_crayon}*{total_crayons} = $<<{cost_per_crayon}*{total_crayons}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} for all the crayons he bought.
